creditline: Gift of funds from the Friends of the Institute
description: light blue; black lacquer cover with small loop handle; wide, flat foot; sides taper inward and flare outward to three scallops--two incised and one pointing outward as a spout
text: Water is ladled from the Mizusashi and heated in a kettle by the Tea Master in order to make tea during the Japanese Tea Ceremony. This jar evokes the purity of the water held within.
title: Water container (mizusashi)
